intro: Gynoxys macrophylla, commonly known as the giant leaf fern, is a striking tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, leathery, compound leaves that can grow up to several feet in length. The plant belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its fronds are typically arranged in a spiral pattern, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Gynoxys macrophylla is valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soil.
